text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
Bundle 0..*BundleCLContains a collection of resources
id S1..1idDebe ser un uuid
identifier 1..1IdentifierIdentificador del documento. Este debe ser igual al del composition.
type 1..1codedocument | message | transaction | transaction-response | batch | batch-response | history | searchset | collection
Required Pattern: document
timestamp 1..1instantInstante en el cual se creó el documento clínico.
entry 1..*BackboneElementEntradas de los recursos.
fullUrl 1..1uriUri del recurso
resource S1..1ResourceRecurso
signature S1..1SignatureDigital Signature
type S1..1CodingIndica el tipo de razón por el cual se firmo los recursos
Required Pattern: At least the following
system1..1uriIdentity of the terminology system
Fixed Value: urn:iso-astm:E1762-95:2013
code1..1codeSymbol in syntax defined by the system
Fixed Value: 1.2.840.10065.1.12.1.5
display1..1stringRepresentation defined by the system
Fixed Value: Verification Signature
when S1..1instantEl momento en que se realizo la firma
who S1..1Reference(Prestador de Salud)Referencia a quien realizo la firma
sigFormat S1..1codeFirma en formato JWS
Required Pattern: application/jose
data S1..1base64BinaryToken de firma

Documentation for this format

name: CdrDocument
title: Bundle Para Documento Clínico
description: Documento en el cual se almacena los signos vitales del paciente previo o durante su consulta.

element.definition: A container for a collection of resources.

constraint.human: total only when a search or history
entry.search only when a search
entry.request mandatory for batch/transaction/history, otherwise prohibited
entry.response mandatory for batch-response/transaction-response/history, otherwise prohibited
FullUrl must be unique in a bundle, or else entries with the same fullUrl must have different meta.versionId (except in history bundles)
constraint.xpath: (f:type/@value = 'history') or (count(for $entry in f:entry[f:resource] return $entry[count(parent::f:Bundle/f:entry[f:fullUrl/@value=$entry/f:fullUrl/@value and ((not(f:resource/*/f:meta/f:versionId/@value) and not($entry/f:resource/*/f:meta/f:versionId/@value)) or f:resource/*/f:meta/f:versionId/@value=$entry/f:resource/*/f:meta/f:versionId/@value)])!=1])=0)

constraint.human: A document must have an identifier with a system and a value
A document must have a date
A document must have a Composition as the first resource
A message must have a MessageHeader as the first resource

element.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
element.comment: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation.

element.definition: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
element.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.
element.comment: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element. Often, when used, the URL is a reference to an implementation guide that defines these special rules as part of it's narrative along with other profiles, value sets, etc.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: This element is labeled as a modifier because the implicit rules may provide additional knowledge about the resource that modifies it's meaning or interpretation

element.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.
element.comment: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource. Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Identificador del documento. Este debe ser igual al del composition.
element.definition: Un identificador persistente para el paquete que no cambiará cuando se copie un paquete de un servidor a otro.
element.comment: La identidad persistente generalmente sólo importa para los lotes de tipo Documento, Mensaje y Colección. Normalmente no se rellena para los resultados de la búsqueda y el historial y los servidores ignoran Bundle.identifier al procesar lotes y transacciones. En el caso de los documentos, el .identifier DEBERÁ rellenarse de forma que el .identifier sea único a nivel mundial.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: document | message | transaction | transaction-response | batch | batch-response | history | searchset | collection
element.definition: Dado que se utilizara este bundle como documento, el código  se fuerza a que sea un 'document'. Este perfil esta creado de tal forma que al cambiar el código por 'transaction' permite obtener toda la información desde el servidor.
element.comment: Es posible utilizar un paquete para otros fines (por ejemplo, un documento puede ser aceptado como una transacción). Esto se define principalmente para que pueda haber reglas específicas para algunos de los tipos de paquetes.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Instante en el cual se creó el documento clínico.
element.definition: La fecha/hora en que se ensambló el paquete, es decir, cuando se colocaron los recursos en el paquete
element.comment: Para muchos paquetes, la marca de tiempo es igual a .meta.lastUpdated, porque no se almacenan (por ejemplo, los resultados de la búsqueda). Cuando un bundle se coloca en un almacén persistente, .meta.lastUpdated suele ser modificado por el servidor. Cuando el bundle es un mensaje, un agente de middleware que altere el mensaje (aunque no esté almacenado) DEBERÍA actualizar .meta.lastUpdated. .timestamp se utiliza para rastrear la hora original del Bundle, y DEBERÍA ser rellenado.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: If search, the total number of matches
element.definition: If a set of search matches, this is the total number of entries of type 'match' across all pages in the search.  It does not include search.mode = 'include' or 'outcome' entries and it does not provide a count of the number of entries in the Bundle.
element.comment: Only used if the bundle is a search result set. The total does not include resources such as OperationOutcome and included resources, only the total number of matching resources.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: A series of links that provide context to this bundle.
element.comment:
Both Bundle.link and Bundle.entry.link are defined to support providing additional context when Bundles are used (e.g. [HATEOAS](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HATEOAS)). 

Bundle.entry.link corresponds to links found in the HTTP header if the resource in the entry was [read](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/http.html#read) directly.

This specification defines some specific uses of Bundle.link for [searching](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/search.html#conformance) and [paging](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/http.html#paging), but no specific uses for Bundle.entry.link, and no defined function in a transaction - the meaning is implementation specific.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
element.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.requirements: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

element.definition: A name which details the functional use for this link - see [http://www.iana.org/assignments/link-relations/link-relations.xhtml#link-relations-1](http://www.iana.org/assignments/link-relations/link-relations.xhtml#link-relations-1).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: The reference details for the link.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Entradas de todos los recursos. Recordar que al ser documento el primer recurso debe ser un Composition.
element.orderMeaning: For bundles of type 'document' and 'message', the first resource is special (must be Composition or MessageHeader respectively). For all bundles, the meaning of the order of entries depends on the bundle type

constraint.human: must be a resource unless there's a request or response
fullUrl cannot be a version specific reference
All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

element.definition: A series of links that provide context to this entry.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition:
The Absolute URL for the resource.  The fullUrl SHALL NOT disagree with the id in the resource - i.e. if the fullUrl is not a urn:uuid, the URL shall be version-independent URL consistent with the Resource.id. The fullUrl is a version independent reference to the resource. The fullUrl element SHALL have a value except that: 
* fullUrl can be empty on a POST (although it does not need to when specifying a temporary id for reference in the bundle)
* Results from operations might involve resources that are not identified.
element.comment:
fullUrl might not be [unique in the context of a resource](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/bundle.html#bundle-unique). Note that since [FHIR resources do not need to be served through the FHIR API](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/references.html), the fullURL might be a URN or an absolute URL that does not end with the logical id of the resource (Resource.id). However, but if the fullUrl does look like a RESTful server URL (e.g. meets the [regex](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/references.html#regex), then the 'id' portion of the fullUrl SHALL end with the Resource.id.

Note that the fullUrl is not the same as the canonical URL - it's an absolute url for an endpoint serving the resource (these will happen to have the same value on the canonical server for the resource with the canonical URL).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: The Resource for the entry. The purpose/meaning of the resource is determined by the Bundle.type.
Information about the search process that lead to the creation of this entry.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

element.short: match | include | outcome - why this is in the result set
element.definition: Why this entry is in the result set - whether it's included as a match or because of an _include requirement, or to convey information or warning information about the search process.
element.comment: There is only one mode. In some corner cases, a resource may be included because it is both a match and an include. In these circumstances, 'match' takes precedence.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Why an entry is in the result set - whether it's included as a match or because of an _include requirement, or to convey information or warning information about the search process.

element.definition: When searching, the server's search ranking score for the entry.
element.comment:
Servers are not required to return a ranking score. 1 is most relevant, and 0 is least relevant. Often, search results are sorted by score, but the client may specify a different sort order.

See [Patient Match](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/patient-operation-match.html) for the EMPI search which relates to this element.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Additional information about how this entry should be processed as part of a transaction or batch.  For history, it shows how the entry was processed to create the version contained in the entry.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

element.short: GET | HEAD | POST | PUT | DELETE | PATCH
element.definition: In a transaction or batch, this is the HTTP action to be executed for this entry. In a history bundle, this indicates the HTTP action that occurred.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: HTTP verbs (in the HTTP command line). See [HTTP rfc](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231) for details.

element.short: URL for HTTP equivalent of this entry
element.definition: The URL for this entry, relative to the root (the address to which the request is posted).
element.comment: E.g. for a Patient Create, the method would be "POST" and the URL would be "Patient". For a Patient Update, the method would be PUT and the URL would be "Patient/[id]".

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: If the ETag values match, return a 304 Not Modified status. See the API documentation for ["Conditional Read"](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/http.html#cread).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Only perform the operation if the last updated date matches. See the API documentation for ["Conditional Read"](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/http.html#cread).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Only perform the operation if the Etag value matches. For more information, see the API section ["Managing Resource Contention"](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/http.html#concurrency).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Instruct the server not to perform the create if a specified resource already exists. For further information, see the API documentation for ["Conditional Create"](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/http.html#ccreate). This is just the query portion of the URL - what follows the "?" (not including the "?").

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Indicates the results of processing the corresponding 'request' entry in the batch or transaction being responded to or what the results of an operation where when returning history.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

element.definition: The status code returned by processing this entry. The status SHALL start with a 3 digit HTTP code (e.g. 404) and may contain the standard HTTP description associated with the status code.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: The location (if the operation returns a location)
element.definition: The location header created by processing this operation, populated if the operation returns a location.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: The Etag for the resource (if relevant)
element.definition: The Etag for the resource, if the operation for the entry produced a versioned resource (see [Resource Metadata and Versioning](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/http.html#versioning) and [Managing Resource Contention](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/http.html#concurrency)).
element.comment: Etags match the Resource.meta.versionId. The ETag has to match the version id in the header if a resource is included.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: The date/time that the resource was modified on the server.
element.comment: This has to match the same time in the meta header (meta.lastUpdated) if a resource is included.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: OperationOutcome with hints and warnings (for batch/transaction)
element.definition: An OperationOutcome containing hints and warnings produced as part of processing this entry in a batch or transaction.
element.comment:
For a POST/PUT operation, this is the equivalent outcome that would be returned for prefer = operationoutcome - except that the resource is always returned whether or not the outcome is returned.

This outcome is not used for error responses in batch/transaction, only for hints and warnings. In a batch operation, the error will be in Bundle.entry.response, and for transaction, there will be a single OperationOutcome instead of a bundle in the case of an error.

element.definition: Digital Signature - base64 encoded. XML-DSig or a JWT.
element.comment: The signature could be created by the "author" of the bundle or by the originating device.   Requirements around inclusion of a signature, verification of signatures and treatment of signed/non-signed bundles is implementation-environment specific.
element.requirements: A Signature holds an electronic representation of a signature and its supporting context in a FHIR accessible form. The signature may either be a cryptographic type (XML DigSig or a JWS), which is able to provide non-repudiation proof, or it may be a graphical image that represents a signature or a signature process. This element allows capturing signatures on documents, messages, transactions or even search responses, to support content-authentication, non-repudiation or other business cases. This is primarily relevant where the bundle may travel through multiple hops or via other mechanisms where HTTPS non-repudiation is insufficient.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Indica el tipo de razón por el cual se firmo los recursos
element.definition: An indication of the reason that the entity signed this document. This may be explicitly included as part of the signature information and can be used when determining accountability for various actions concerning the document.
element.comment: Examples include attesting to: authorship, correct transcription, and witness of specific event. Also known as a "Commitment Type Indication".

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: An indication of the reason that an entity signed the object.

element.short: El momento en que se realizo la firma
element.definition: When the digital signature was signed.
element.comment: This should agree with the information in the signature.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Referencia a quien realizo la firma
element.definition: A reference to an application-usable description of the identity that signed  (e.g. the signature used their private key).
element.comment: This should agree with the information in the signature.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: A reference to an application-usable description of the identity that is represented by the signature.
element.comment: The party that can't sign. For example a child.
element.requirements: used when the signature is on behalf of a non-signer.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: The technical format of the signed resources
element.definition: A mime type that indicates the technical format of the target resources signed by the signature.
element.comment: "xml", "json" and "ttl" are allowed, which describe the simple encodings described in the specification (and imply appropriate bundle support). Otherwise, mime types are legal here.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: The mime type of an attachment. Any valid mime type is allowed.

element.definition: A mime type that indicates the technical format of the signature. Important mime types are application/signature+xml for X ML DigSig, application/jose for JWS, and image/* for a graphical image of a signature, etc.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: The mime type of an attachment. Any valid mime type is allowed.

element.definition: The base64 encoding of the Signature content. When signature is not recorded electronically this element would be empty.
element.comment: Where the signature type is an XML DigSig, the signed content is a FHIR Resource(s), the signature is of the XML form of the Resource(s) using  XML-Signature (XMLDIG) "Detached Signature" form.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Identificador del documento. Este debe ser igual al del composition.
document | message | transaction | transaction-response | batch | batch-response | history | searchset | collection
element.definition: Dado que se utilizara este bundle como documento, el código  se fuerza a que sea un 'document'. Este perfil esta creado de tal forma que al cambiar el código por 'transaction' permite obtener toda la información desde el servidor.

element.short: Instante en el cual se creó el documento clínico.

element.definition: Entradas de todos los recursos. Recordar que al ser documento el primer recurso debe ser un Composition.

element.short: Indica el tipo de razón por el cual se firmo los recursos
El momento en que se realizo la firma
Referencia a quien realizo la firma
